intro: Amsinckia acuticarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Amsinckia acuticarpa is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
